trans-unit.source: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to view and manage volumes | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to view and manage volumes | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager MMC snap-in to view and manage volumes.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager MMC snap-in to view and manage volumes.

trans-unit.source: You can use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager Volumes node (on the Scope pane) to select volumes and view information about them.
trans-unit.target: You can use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager Volumes node (on the Scope pane) to select volumes and view information about them.

trans-unit.source: The volumes are presented as drives that correspond to the volumes mounted by the host.
trans-unit.target: The volumes are presented as drives that correspond to the volumes mounted by the host.

trans-unit.source: The Volumes node shows local volumes and volume types that are supported by Azure StorSimple, including volumes discovered through the use of iSCSI and a device.
trans-unit.target: The Volumes node shows local volumes and volume types that are supported by Azure StorSimple, including volumes discovered through the use of iSCSI and a device.

trans-unit.source: For more information about supported volumes, go to <linkText>Support for multiple volume types</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about supported volumes, go to <linkText>Support for multiple volume types</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Volume list in Results pane</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Volume list in Results pane</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 1: StorSimple Snapshot Manager Volumes node
trans-unit.target: Figure 1: StorSimple Snapshot Manager Volumes node

trans-unit.source: The Volumes node also lets you rescan or delete volumes after StorSimple Snapshot Manager discovers them.
trans-unit.target: The Volumes node also lets you rescan or delete volumes after StorSimple Snapshot Manager discovers them.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how you can mount, initialize, and format volumes and then use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how you can mount, initialize, and format volumes and then use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to:

trans-unit.source: View information about volumes
trans-unit.target: View information about volumes

trans-unit.source: Delete volumes
trans-unit.target: Delete volumes

trans-unit.source: Rescan volumes
trans-unit.target: Rescan volumes

trans-unit.source: Configure a basic volume and back it up
trans-unit.target: Configure a basic volume and back it up

trans-unit.source: Configure a dynamic mirrored volume and back it up
trans-unit.target: Configure a dynamic mirrored volume and back it up

trans-unit.source: All of the Volume node actions are also available in the Actions pane.
trans-unit.target: All of the Volume node actions are also available in the Actions pane.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to mount, initialize, and format Azure StorSimple volumes.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to mount, initialize, and format Azure StorSimple volumes.

trans-unit.source: On your host computer, start the Microsoft iSCSI initiator.
trans-unit.target: On your host computer, start the Microsoft iSCSI initiator.

trans-unit.source: Supply one of the interface IP addresses as the target portal or discovery IP address, and connect to the device.
trans-unit.target: Supply one of the interface IP addresses as the target portal or discovery IP address, and connect to the device.

trans-unit.source: After the device is connected, the volumes will be accessible to your Windows system.
trans-unit.target: After the device is connected, the volumes will be accessible to your Windows system.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the Microsoft iSCSI initiator, go to the section “Connecting to an iSCSI target device” in <linkText>Installing and Configuring Microsoft iSCSI Initiator[1]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the Microsoft iSCSI initiator, go to the section “Connecting to an iSCSI target device” in <linkText>Installing and Configuring Microsoft iSCSI Initiator[1]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use any of the following options to start the Disk Management snap-in:
trans-unit.target: Use any of the following options to start the Disk Management snap-in:

trans-unit.source: Type Diskmgmt.msc in the Run box.
trans-unit.target: Type Diskmgmt.msc in the Run box.

trans-unit.source: Start Server Manager, expand the Storage node, and then select Disk Management.
trans-unit.target: Start Server Manager, expand the Storage node, and then select Disk Management.

trans-unit.source: Start Administrative Tools, expand the Computer Management node, and then select Disk Management.
trans-unit.target: Start Administrative Tools, expand the Computer Management node, and then select Disk Management.

trans-unit.source: You must use administrator privileges to run Disk Management.
trans-unit.target: You must use administrator privileges to run Disk Management.

trans-unit.source: Take the volume(s) online:
trans-unit.target: Take the volume(s) online:

trans-unit.source: In Disk Management, right-click any volume marked Offline.
trans-unit.target: In Disk Management, right-click any volume marked Offline.

trans-unit.source: Click Reactivate Disk.
trans-unit.target: Click Reactivate Disk.

trans-unit.source: The disk should be marked Online after the disk is reactivated.
trans-unit.target: The disk should be marked Online after the disk is reactivated.

trans-unit.source: Initialize the volume(s):
trans-unit.target: Initialize the volume(s):

trans-unit.source: Right-click the discovered volumes.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the discovered volumes.

trans-unit.source: On the menu, select Initialize Disk.
trans-unit.target: On the menu, select Initialize Disk.

trans-unit.source: In the Initialize Disk dialog box, select the disks that you want to initialize, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Initialize Disk dialog box, select the disks that you want to initialize, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Format simple volumes:
trans-unit.target: Format simple volumes:

trans-unit.source: Right-click a volume that you want to format.
trans-unit.target: Right-click a volume that you want to format.

trans-unit.source: On the menu, select New Simple Volume.
trans-unit.target: On the menu, select New Simple Volume.

trans-unit.source: Use the New Simple Volume wizard to format the volume:
trans-unit.target: Use the New Simple Volume wizard to format the volume:

trans-unit.source: Specify the volume size.
trans-unit.target: Specify the volume size.

trans-unit.source: Supply a drive letter.
trans-unit.target: Supply a drive letter.

trans-unit.source: Select the NTFS file system.
trans-unit.target: Select the NTFS file system.

trans-unit.source: Specify a 64 KB allocation unit size.
trans-unit.target: Specify a 64 KB allocation unit size.

trans-unit.source: Perform a quick format.
trans-unit.target: Perform a quick format.

trans-unit.source: Format multi-partition volumes.
trans-unit.target: Format multi-partition volumes.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, go to the section, "Partitions and Volumes" in <linkText>Implementing Disk Management</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, go to the section, "Partitions and Volumes" in <linkText>Implementing Disk Management</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to view information about local and Azure StorSimple volumes.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to view information about local and Azure StorSimple volumes.

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, click the Volumes node.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, click the Volumes node.

trans-unit.source: A list of local and mounted volumes, including all Azure StorSimple volumes, appears in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: A list of local and mounted volumes, including all Azure StorSimple volumes, appears in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: The columns in the Results pane are configurable.
trans-unit.target: The columns in the Results pane are configurable.

trans-unit.source: (Right-click the Volumes node, select View, and then select Add/Remove Columns.)
trans-unit.target: (Right-click the Volumes node, select View, and then select Add/Remove Columns.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure the columns</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure the columns</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Results column | Description :--------------|:------------- Name | The Name column contains the drive letter assigned to each discovered volume.
trans-unit.target: Results column | Description :--------------|:------------- Name | The Name column contains the drive letter assigned to each discovered volume.

trans-unit.source: Device | The Device column contains the IP address of the device connected to the host computer.
trans-unit.target: Device | The Device column contains the IP address of the device connected to the host computer.

trans-unit.source: Device Volume Name | The Device Volume Name column contains the name of the device volume to which the selected volume belongs.
trans-unit.target: Device Volume Name | The Device Volume Name column contains the name of the device volume to which the selected volume belongs.

trans-unit.source: This is the volume name defined in the Azure Management Portal for that specific volume.
trans-unit.target: This is the volume name defined in the Azure Management Portal for that specific volume.

trans-unit.source: Access Paths | The Access Paths column displays the access path to the volume.
trans-unit.target: Access Paths | The Access Paths column displays the access path to the volume.

trans-unit.source: This is the drive letter or mount point at which the volume is accessible on the host computer.
trans-unit.target: This is the drive letter or mount point at which the volume is accessible on the host computer.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to delete a volume from StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to delete a volume from StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: You cannot delete a volume if it is part of any volume group. (The delete option is not available for volumes that are members of a volume group.) You must delete the entire volume group to delete the volume.
trans-unit.target: You cannot delete a volume if it is part of any volume group. (The delete option is not available for volumes that are members of a volume group.) You must delete the entire volume group to delete the volume.

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, click the Volumes node.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, click the Volumes node.

trans-unit.source: In the Results pane, right-click the volume that you want to delete.
trans-unit.target: In the Results pane, right-click the volume that you want to delete.

trans-unit.source: On the menu, click Delete.
trans-unit.target: On the menu, click Delete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Delete a volume</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Delete a volume</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Delete Volume dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The Delete Volume dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Type Confirm in the text box, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Type Confirm in the text box, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: By default, StorSimple Snapshot Manager backs up a volume before deleting it.
trans-unit.target: By default, StorSimple Snapshot Manager backs up a volume before deleting it.

trans-unit.source: This precaution can protect you from data loss if the deletion was unintentional.
trans-unit.target: This precaution can protect you from data loss if the deletion was unintentional.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager displays an Automatic Snapshot progress message while it backs up the volume.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager displays an Automatic Snapshot progress message while it backs up the volume.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Automatic snapshot message</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Automatic snapshot message</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to rescan the volumes connected to StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to rescan the volumes connected to StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, right-click Volumes, and then click Rescan volumes.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, right-click Volumes, and then click Rescan volumes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Rescan volumes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Rescan volumes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This procedure synchronizes the volume list with StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: This procedure synchronizes the volume list with StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: Any changes, such as new volumes or deleted volumes, will be reflected in the results.
trans-unit.target: Any changes, such as new volumes or deleted volumes, will be reflected in the results.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to configure a backup of a basic volume, and then either start a backup immediately or create a policy for scheduled backups.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to configure a backup of a basic volume, and then either start a backup immediately or create a policy for scheduled backups.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the StorSimple device and host computer are configured correctly.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the StorSimple device and host computer are configured correctly.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to <linkText>Deploy your on-premises StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to <linkText>Deploy your on-premises StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Install and configure StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to <linkText>Deploy StorSimple Snapshot Manager</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to <linkText>Deploy StorSimple Snapshot Manager</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a basic volume on the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Create a basic volume on the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Mount, initialize, and format the volume as described in <linkText>Mount volumes</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Mount, initialize, and format the volume as described in <linkText>Mount volumes</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click the StorSimple Snapshot Manager icon on your desktop.
trans-unit.target: Click the StorSimple Snapshot Manager icon on your desktop.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager window appears.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager window appears.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, right-click the Volumes node, and then select Rescan volumes.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, right-click the Volumes node, and then select Rescan volumes.

trans-unit.source: When the scan is finished, a list of volumes should appear in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: When the scan is finished, a list of volumes should appear in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: In the Results pane, right-click the volume, and then select Create Volume Group.
trans-unit.target: In the Results pane, right-click the volume, and then select Create Volume Group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create volume group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create volume group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create Volume Group dialog box, type a name for the volume group, assign volumes to it, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Create Volume Group dialog box, type a name for the volume group, assign volumes to it, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, expand the Volume Groups node.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, expand the Volume Groups node.

trans-unit.source: The new volume group should appear under the Volume Groups node.
trans-unit.target: The new volume group should appear under the Volume Groups node.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the volume group name.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the volume group name.

trans-unit.source: To start an interactive (on-demand) backup job, click Take Backup.
trans-unit.target: To start an interactive (on-demand) backup job, click Take Backup.

trans-unit.source: To schedule an automatic backup, click Create Backup Policy.
trans-unit.target: To schedule an automatic backup, click Create Backup Policy.

trans-unit.source: On the General page, select a volume group from the list.
trans-unit.target: On the General page, select a volume group from the list.

trans-unit.source: On the Schedule page, enter the schedule details.
trans-unit.target: On the Schedule page, enter the schedule details.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, click OK.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished, click OK.

trans-unit.source: To confirm that the backup job has started, expand the Jobs node in the Scope pane, and then click the Running node.
trans-unit.target: To confirm that the backup job has started, expand the Jobs node in the Scope pane, and then click the Running node.

trans-unit.source: The list of currently running jobs appears in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: The list of currently running jobs appears in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: Complete the following steps to configure backup for a dynamic mirrored volume:
trans-unit.target: Complete the following steps to configure backup for a dynamic mirrored volume:

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Use Disk Management to create a dynamic mirrored volume
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Use Disk Management to create a dynamic mirrored volume

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to configure backup
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to configure backup

trans-unit.source: Before you begin:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the StorSimple device and host computer are configured correctly.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the StorSimple device and host computer are configured correctly.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to <linkText>Deploy your on-premises StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to <linkText>Deploy your on-premises StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Install and configure StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to <linkText>Deploy StorSimple Snapshot Manager</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to <linkText>Deploy StorSimple Snapshot Manager</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Configure two volumes on the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Configure two volumes on the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: (In the examples, the available volumes are Disk 1 and Disk 2.)
trans-unit.target: (In the examples, the available volumes are Disk 1 and Disk 2.)

trans-unit.source: Disk Management is a system utility for managing hard disks and the volumes or partitions that they contain.
trans-unit.target: Disk Management is a system utility for managing hard disks and the volumes or partitions that they contain.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Disk Management, go to <linkText>Disk Management</linkText><title></title> on the Microsoft TechNet website.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Disk Management, go to <linkText>Disk Management</linkText><title></title> on the Microsoft TechNet website.

trans-unit.source: Use any of the following options to start Disk Management:
trans-unit.target: Use any of the following options to start Disk Management:

trans-unit.source: Open the Run box, type Diskmgmt.msc, and press Enter.
trans-unit.target: Open the Run box, type Diskmgmt.msc, and press Enter.

trans-unit.source: Start Server Manager, expand the Storage node, and then select Disk Management.
trans-unit.target: Start Server Manager, expand the Storage node, and then select Disk Management.

trans-unit.source: Start Administrative Tools, expand the Computer Management node, and then select Disk Management.
trans-unit.target: Start Administrative Tools, expand the Computer Management node, and then select Disk Management.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have two volumes available on the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have two volumes available on the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: (In the example, the available volumes are Disk 1 and Disk 2.)
trans-unit.target: (In the example, the available volumes are Disk 1 and Disk 2.)

trans-unit.source: In the Disk Management window, in the right column of the lower pane, right-click Disk 1 and select New Mirrored Volume.
trans-unit.target: In the Disk Management window, in the right column of the lower pane, right-click Disk 1 and select New Mirrored Volume.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Mirrored Volume</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Mirrored Volume</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the New Mirrored Volume wizard page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the New Mirrored Volume wizard page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select Disks page, select Disk 2 in the Selected pane, click Add, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select Disks page, select Disk 2 in the Selected pane, click Add, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Assign Drive Letter or Path page, accept the defaults, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Assign Drive Letter or Path page, accept the defaults, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Format Volume page, in the Allocation Unit Size box, select 64K.
trans-unit.target: On the Format Volume page, in the Allocation Unit Size box, select 64K.

trans-unit.source: Select the Perform a quick format check box, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Select the Perform a quick format check box, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Completing the New Mirrored Volume page, review your settings, and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the Completing the New Mirrored Volume page, review your settings, and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: A message appears to indicate that the basic disk will be converted to a dynamic disk.
trans-unit.target: A message appears to indicate that the basic disk will be converted to a dynamic disk.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dynamic disk conversion message</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dynamic disk conversion message</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Disk Management, verify that Disk 1 and Disk 2 are shown as dynamic mirrored volumes.
trans-unit.target: In Disk Management, verify that Disk 1 and Disk 2 are shown as dynamic mirrored volumes.

trans-unit.source: (Dynamic should appear in the status column, and the capacity bar color should change to red, indicating a mirrored volume.)
trans-unit.target: (Dynamic should appear in the status column, and the capacity bar color should change to red, indicating a mirrored volume.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Disk Management mirrored dynamic disks</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Disk Management mirrored dynamic disks</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to configure a dynamic mirrored volume, and then either start a backup immediately or create a policy for scheduled backups.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to configure a dynamic mirrored volume, and then either start a backup immediately or create a policy for scheduled backups.

trans-unit.source: Click the StorSimple Snapshot Manager icon on your desktop.
trans-unit.target: Click the StorSimple Snapshot Manager icon on your desktop.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager window appears.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager window appears.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, right-click the Volumes node and select Rescan volumes.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, right-click the Volumes node and select Rescan volumes.

trans-unit.source: When the scan is finished, a list of volumes should appear in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: When the scan is finished, a list of volumes should appear in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: The dynamic mirrored volume is listed as a single volume.
trans-unit.target: The dynamic mirrored volume is listed as a single volume.

trans-unit.source: In the Results pane, right-click the dynamic mirrored volume, and then click Create Volume Group.
trans-unit.target: In the Results pane, right-click the dynamic mirrored volume, and then click Create Volume Group.

trans-unit.source: In the Create Volume Group dialog box, type a name for the volume group, assign the dynamic mirrored volume to this group, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Create Volume Group dialog box, type a name for the volume group, assign the dynamic mirrored volume to this group, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, expand the Volume Groups node.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, expand the Volume Groups node.

trans-unit.source: The new volume group should appear under the Volume Groups node.
trans-unit.target: The new volume group should appear under the Volume Groups node.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the volume group name.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the volume group name.

trans-unit.source: To start an interactive (on-demand) backup job, click Take Backup.
trans-unit.target: To start an interactive (on-demand) backup job, click Take Backup.

trans-unit.source: To schedule an automatic backup, click Create Backup Policy.
trans-unit.target: To schedule an automatic backup, click Create Backup Policy.

trans-unit.source: On the General page, select the volume group from the list.
trans-unit.target: On the General page, select the volume group from the list.

trans-unit.source: On the Schedule page, enter the schedule details.
trans-unit.target: On the Schedule page, enter the schedule details.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, click OK.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished, click OK.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the backup job as it runs.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the backup job as it runs.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, expand the Jobs node, and then click Running, The job details appear in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, expand the Jobs node, and then click Running, The job details appear in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: When the backup job is finished, the details are transferred to the Last 24 hours job list.
trans-unit.target: When the backup job is finished, the details are transferred to the Last 24 hours job list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage volume groups</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage volume groups</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee338480(v=ws.10).aspx
trans-unit.target: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee338480(v=ws.10).aspx
